title: 114_hr3746
content: State Marihuana And Regulatory Tolerance Enforcement Act This bill amends the Controlled Substances Act to prohibit federal enforcement of marijuana offenses in a state that: (1) requests a waiver from the Department of Justice (DOJ) certifying that it legalized marijuana, (2) demonstrates a regulatory scheme sufficient to protect federal interests. And (3) agrees to study and report on certain outcomes. DOJ may revoke the waiver of a state that fails to meets the conditions. nbsp,
